modules.description: Processes command-line parameter documentation by extracting and formatting descriptive text associated with each parameter from an abstract syntax tree. Operates on a parameter structure and a documentation string to generate human-readable output. Used to dynamically generate help messages based on defined command-line arguments.

Provides a function to generate manpage entries from a readme string generator, processing each entry as a formatted string. Works with a list of tagged entries, where each tag indicates the type of manpage section. Used to dynamically create documentation sections from structured readme content.

Extracts and formats command-line parameter documentation from an abstract syntax tree, producing human-readable help messages. Generates manpage entries from structured readme content, organizing them into sections based on tags. Processes parameter structures and tagged entries to dynamically create documentation. Supports tasks like auto-generating help text and manpages from source definitions.

Extracts and formats command-line parameter documentation from an abstract syntax tree, generating human-readable help messages and structured manpage entries. It organizes content into sections using tags, dynamically building documentation from parameter structures and tagged entries. Operations include parsing, transforming, and rendering help text and manpages. Examples include auto-generating help output and manpages from source definitions.

Provides a domain-specific language for defining command-line interfaces, translating declarative specifications into executable commands for cmdliner, core.command, or climate. Operates on structured command definitions, including subcommands, options, and positional arguments. Used to generate robust, type-safe command-line tools with minimal boilerplate.

Extracts and formats command-line parameter documentation from an abstract syntax tree, generating structured help messages and manpage entries. It organizes content into sections using tags, enabling dynamic documentation generation from parameter definitions. Operations include parsing, transforming, and rendering help text and manpages. Examples include auto-generating help output and manpages from source definitions.
